title: What would Xerath do in oppressive, immense Void Invasion?

embed.description: Kick arse. Take names. Go crazy. Take everything.

body:
I asked this question to Jaredan, thanks a lot to him he answered. Actually, even while I'm annoymous he answers a lot of my questions. 

But there is something that I dont understand. This answer is brutal. He literallys say he would fight against both sides. Voidborns and Runeterrans. 

The things are, Void is the biggest threat for Runeterra. If Runeterra falls, you probably have no possible way to clear them from Runeterra again. Even if you could, there wouldn't be something such as life anymore (except a few Voidborns ofc). There wouldn't be something to rule, there wouldn't be something to show your power that highly feeds your ego, which is a perfect pleasure for an arrogant entity like Xerath. Which is what Xerath wants a lot. His literal purpose is getting more and more power + absolute rule. (Ruler of Runeterra)

Why do I feel like Xerath would make an ally with Runeterrans, at least with such as Noxus, Demacia, Zaun or whatever for a short time? Until they clean the Voidborns? But why would he do that? Most probably because of the things that I said above. Of course totally not with Azir and Nasus, but Xerath is not an entity who could crush anyone he sees. He is not a mindless creature like Rek'Sai. He can talk with you, he can try to use you for his benefits. Examples are followers of Xerath that killed by Nasus.

I just wanna see Xerath in good side for even a short time, even when it is for his benefits. It would be cool and make him totally a grey character, rather than the biggest threat after Void. Really, he is even more dangerous than Shadow Isles in douchebag mode.

So, what do you think? What would he do in your eyes? What would he become? A total asshole, or a powerful ally? Or goes crazy and figures he can dry out the void energy even while he knows nothing good will come from doing this?

replies.body: Keep in mind Xerath will have a character arc, as will Azir, Sivir et al.   I feel your pain.  I have a lot of sympathy for Xerath (I helped out on re-breaking his arc a couple years back)  Xerath isn't all bad-- he's a person ruined by circumstance and by the person he cared for the most betraying his trust.  He's a human being (or was at least).  Currently what he is doing is evil and selfish, but you can't have the dawn without the night.  I can't say if Xerath will have redemption, but his perspective will change.   Azir and Xerath are imprisoned by the past.... Sivir holds the key.
So Shurima is going to fall again?
Perhaps it never really rose.
Dude...  that's deep.
And it makes sense. All he rose were buildings. It's people have long since moved on.
Mind blown.

I just don't want to see him go: "I was wrong all along" on his dieing breath.

What would be awesome in my opinion is that in the future he redeems himself in the eyes of the Ascension rather than Azir/Susan and Co. and while keeping his character he becomes ana ccpeted Ascended making his Guardian of the Sands skin canon.

I think that is not possible, ritual is done. Ascension doesn't live in him anymore, it has no mind. Ascension only acts like it has mind when it is in work. While you're about to ascend, your personality (your deep soul or whatever) affects the ritual. Xerath had much more dark side than any other Ascendant, also kept the ritual too far long. That's the reason why he is completely differen than other Ascendants, not because he is keeping his personality in dark side.

In other say, even if he changed, it would change nothing. 

Also, Guardian of the Sands Xerath has alternative lore. A serious one:


_Deep in the sands lies an arcane temple forsaken by a ruined kingdom. Deep in that temple lies an imposing tomb burnished with mystic runes and emerald scarabs. Deep in that tomb lies an ancient being of treacherous power._

_These guys guard the temple next to that one._

Too serious.
